snippet: The families got their first glimpse of the schoolgirls since last month, when they were abducted by the Islamist group Boko Haram, whose leader has threatened to sell them.
abstract: Parents and relatives of about 300 Nigerian schoolgirls kidnapped by radical Islamist group Boko Haram receive first glimpse of their children when authorities show video released by group; while video may have provided some relief to the relatives and parents, relief quickly turns to anger, as there are no indications that the girls are any closer to being located.
lead_paragraph: The families got their first glimpse of the schoolgirls since last month, when they were abducted by the Islamist group Boko Haram, whose leader has threatened to sell them.

headline.main: Small Comfort as Parents Identify Kidnapped Nigerian Girls on Video
headline.print_headline: Small Comfort as Parents See Girls on Video
